title: Authors and Citation
text: Rémi Thériault. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Thériault R (2023). pubmedDashboard: Creating PubMed Data Visualization Dashboards. https://github.com/rempsyc/pubmedDashboard, https://rempsyc.github.io/pubmedDashboard/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pubmedDashboard: Creating PubMed Data Visualization Dashboards},   author = {Rémi Thériault},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/rempsyc/pubmedDashboard, https://rempsyc.github.io/pubmedDashboard/}, }

title: Creating PubMed Data Visualization Dashboards
text: goal pubmedDashboard facilitate creation pretty data visualization dashboards using flexdashboard easyPubMed packages.

title: Creating PubMed Data Visualization Dashboards
text: can install development version pubmedDashboard like :

title: Creating PubMed Data Visualization Dashboards
text: pubmedDashboard helps parse address identify department university affiliation, well country.
code: library(pubmedDashboard)  address <- c(   "Department of Psychology, Cornell University, Ithaca, New York 14853-7601.",   "Dipartimento di Psicologia Generale, Università di Padova, Italy.",   "Universität Mannheim, Federal Republic of Germany.",   "Département de psychologie, Université du Québec à Montréal, Canada." )  get_affiliation(address, "department") #> [1] "Department of Psychology"            "Dipartimento di Psicologia Generale" #> [3] NA                                    "Département de psychologie"  get_affiliation(address, "university") #> [1] "Cornell University"              "Università di Padova"            #> [3] "Universität Mannheim"            "Université du Québec à Montréal"  get_country(address) #> [1] "United States" "Italy"         "Germany"       "Canada"

title: Creating PubMed Data Visualization Dashboards
text: One simple function allows download paper data PubMed, convert XLM data dataframe, extract affiliations, match universities countries, identify countries continents, save file disk later reuse.
code: save_process_pubmed_batch(   pubmed_query_string = "passion [Title/Abstract]",   journal = c("Journal of Personality and Social Psychology", "Health Psychology"),   year_low = 2023,   year_high = 2030 ) #> pubmed_query_string = #>  passion [Title/Abstract] AND Journal of Personality and Social Psychology [Journal]  #>  OR Health Psychology [Journal] AND ('2023/01/01' [Date - Publication] : '2030/12/31' #>  [Date - Publication])  #>  1/5 - Downloading PubMed data... [10:34:20 AM] #> [1] "PubMed data batch 1 / 1 downloaded..." #> 2/5 - Converting XLM files to dataframe... [10:34:23 AM] #> 3/5 - Extracting affiliations... [10:34:40 AM] #> 4/5 - Matching universities to countries... [10:34:40 AM] #> 5/5 - Identifying countries and continents... [10:34:44 AM] #> Operation successfully completed. Congratulations! [10:34:59 AM] #>  File saved in data/articles_2023_2030.rds

title: Creating PubMed Data Visualization Dashboards
text: Various functions allow prepare DT tables display specific information, journal paper percentages continent country.

Creating PubMed Data Visualization Dashboards

what: Add affiliations to pubmedDashboard dataframe — add_affiliation
title: Add affiliations to pubmedDashboard dataframe — add_affiliation
text: Add affiliations pubmedDashboard dataframe

title: Add affiliations to pubmedDashboard dataframe — add_affiliation
Add affiliations to pubmedDashboard dataframe — add_affiliation
text: data dataframe add affiliations (department university).

title: Add affiliations to pubmedDashboard dataframe — add_affiliation
code: # \dontshow{ .old_wd <- setwd(tempdir()) # } if (FALSE) { pubmed_query_string <- paste(   "passion [Title/Abstract]",   "AND Dualistic Model of Passion [Text Word]",   "AND ('2023/01/01' [Date - Publication] : '2023/12/31' [Date - Publication])" )  d.fls <- batch_pubmed_download2(   pubmed_query_string = pubmed_query_string,   year_low = 2023,   year_high = 2023 ) articles.df <- all_articles_to_df(d.fls) articles.df2 <- add_affiliation(articles.df) articles.df2[5, ] } # \dontshow{ unlink("easyPubMed_data_01.txt") setwd(.old_wd) # }

title: Add regions to pubmedDashboard dataframe — add_region
code: # \dontshow{ .old_wd <- setwd(tempdir()) # } if (FALSE) { d.fls <- batch_pubmed_download2(   pubmed_query_string = paste(     "passion [Title/Abstract]",     "AND Dualistic Model of Passion [Text Word]",     "AND ('2023/01/01' [Date - Publication] : '2023/12/31' [Date - Publication])"   ),   year_low = 2023,   year_high = 2023 ) articles.df <- all_articles_to_df(d.fls) articles.df2 <- add_affiliation(articles.df) articles.df3 <- match_university(articles.df2) articles.df4 <- add_region(articles.df3) articles.df4[2, ] } # \dontshow{ unlink("easyPubMed_data_01.txt") setwd(.old_wd) # }

title: Convert list of PubMed XLM files to dataframe — all_articles_to_df
code: # \dontshow{ .old_wd <- setwd(tempdir()) # } if (FALSE) { pubmed_query_string <- paste(   "passion [Title/Abstract]",   "AND Dualistic Model of Passion [Text Word]",   "AND ('2023/01/01' [Date - Publication] : '2023/12/31' [Date - Publication])" ) d.fls <- batch_pubmed_download2(   pubmed_query_string = pubmed_query_string,   year_low = 2023,   year_high = 2023 ) articles.df <- all_articles_to_df(d.fls) articles.df[5, ] } # \dontshow{ unlink("easyPubMed_data_01.txt") setwd(.old_wd) # }

what: Convert PubMed XLM files to dataframe — article_to_df2
title: Convert PubMed XLM files to dataframe — article_to_df2
text: Convert PubMed XLM files dataframe

title: Convert PubMed XLM files to dataframe — article_to_df2
code: article_to_df2(   pubmedArticle,   autofill = FALSE,   max_chars = 500,   getKeywords = FALSE,   getAuthors = TRUE )

title: Convert PubMed XLM files to dataframe — article_to_df2
text: pubmedArticle PubMed data, XLM form. autofill Autofill affiliation address missing. max_chars Maximum number characters address. getKeywords Whether extract keywords well. getAuthors Whether extract author information.

title: Convert PubMed XLM files to dataframe — article_to_df2
code: # \dontshow{ .old_wd <- setwd(tempdir()) # } if (FALSE) { dami_query <- paste(   "passion [Title/Abstract]",   "AND Dualistic Model of Passion [Text Word]",   "AND ('2023/01/01' [Date - Publication] : '2023/12/31' [Date - Publication])" ) dami_on_pubmed <- easyPubMed::get_pubmed_ids(dami_query) dami_abstracts_xml <- easyPubMed::fetch_pubmed_data(dami_on_pubmed) dami_abstracts_list <- easyPubMed::articles_to_list(dami_abstracts_xml) article_to_df2(pubmedArticle = dami_abstracts_list[[2]], autofill = FALSE)[1, ] } # \dontshow{ unlink("easyPubMed_data_01.txt") setwd(.old_wd) # }

title: Download PubMed data with query string — batch_pubmed_download2

text: splitted.address address splitted stringr::str_split. string keyword determine string component keep.

title: Extracts correct component from a splitted affiliation address — extract_split_address
code: address <- c(   "Department of Psychology",   " Cornell University",   " Ithaca",   " New York 14853-7601." )  extract_split_address(address, "University") #> [1] NA                   "Cornell University" NA                   #> [4] NA                   extract_split_address(address, "Department") #> [1] "Department of Psychology" NA                         #> [3] NA                         NA

title: Get affiliations — get_affiliation
code: address <- c(   "Department of Psychology, Cornell University, Ithaca, New York 14853-7601.",   "Dipartimento di Psicologia Generale, Università di Padova, Italy.",   "Universität Mannheim, Federal Republic of Germany.",   "Département de psychologie, Université du Québec à Montréal, Canada." )  get_affiliation(address, "department") #> [1] "Department of Psychology"            "Dipartimento di Psicologia Generale" #> [3] NA                                    "Département de psychologie"          get_affiliation(address, "university") #> [1] "Cornell University"   "Università di Padova" "Universität Mannheim" #> [4] NA

title: Get country — get_country
code: # \dontshow{ .old_wd <- setwd(tempdir()) # } if (FALSE) { d.fls <- batch_pubmed_download2(   pubmed_query_string = paste(     "passion [Title/Abstract]",     "AND Dualistic Model of Passion [Text Word]",     "AND ('2023/01/01' [Date - Publication] : '2023/12/31' [Date - Publication])"   ),   year_low = 2023,   year_high = 2023 ) articles.df <- all_articles_to_df(d.fls) articles.df2 <- add_affiliation(articles.df) articles.df3 <- match_university(articles.df2) get_country(articles.df3$address) } # \dontshow{ unlink("easyPubMed_data_01.txt") setwd(.old_wd) # }

title: Like Excel vlookup/grep, both both ways — partial_vlookup
code: address <- c(   "Department of Psychology, Cornell University, Ithaca, New York 14853-7601.",   "Dipartimento di Psicologia Generale, Università di Padova, Italy.",   "Universität Mannheim, Federal Republic of Germany.",   "Département de psychologie, Université du Québec à Montréal, Canada." ) partial_vlookup(address, universities$university) #> [1] "Cornell University" NA                   NA                   #> [4] NA                   uni <- c(   "Cornell University", "Università di Padova",   "Universität Mannheim", "Université du Québec à Montréal" ) partial_vlookup(uni, universities$university) #> [1] "Cornell University" NA                   NA                   #> [4] NA

title: Mega function to process and save PubMed data — save_process_pubmed_batch
code: save_process_pubmed_batch(   pubmed_query_string = "",   journal = NULL,   year_low = 2023,   year_high = 2023,   data_folder = "data",   batch_size = 5000,   api_key = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Mega function to process and save PubMed data — save_process_pubmed_batch
text: pubmed_query_string PubMed query string. journal list desired journals. year_low year data start. year_high year data end. data_folder save data. batch_size download batch size. api_key api key faster processing (optional). verbose Whether include progress messages.

title: Mega function to process and save PubMed data — save_process_pubmed_batch
code: # \dontshow{ .old_wd <- setwd(tempdir()) # } if (FALSE) { pubmed_query_string <- paste(   "passion [Title/Abstract]",   "AND Dualistic Model of Passion [Text Word]" )  save_process_pubmed_batch(   pubmed_query_string,   year_low = 2023,   year_high = 2023 ) } # \dontshow{ unlink("easyPubMed_data_01.txt") setwd(.old_wd) # }
